methods.name: createDefaultChart
desc: Creates a default chart type for a brand-new chart object.

methods.name: createInternalDataProvider
desc: creates an internal com.sun.star.chart2.XDataProvider that is handled by the chart document itself.
When the model is stored, the data provider will also be stored in a sub-storage.

methods.name: getChartTypeManager
desc: retrieves the component that is able to create different chart type templates (components of type ChartTypeTemplate)

methods.name: getDataProvider
desc: Returns the currently set data provider.
This may be an internal one, if createInternalDataProvider() has been called before, or an external one if XDataReceiver.attachDataProvider() has been called.

methods.name: getFirstDiagram
desc: Notes: this is preliminary, we need an API that supports more than one diagram. The method name getDiagram exists in the css.chart API, so there is would be no way to chose either this or the other method from Basic (it would chose one or the other by random).

methods.name: getPageBackground
desc: Gives access to the page background appearance.

The area's extent is equal to the document size. If you want to access properties of the background area of a single diagram (the part where data points are actually plotted in), you have to get its wall. You can get the wall by calling XDiagram.getWall().

methods.name: hasInternalDataProvider
desc: This is the case directly after createInternalDataProvider() has been called, but this is not necessary. The chart can also create an internal data provider by other means, e.g. a call to com.sun.star.frame.XModel.initNew().

methods.name: setChartTypeManager
desc: sets a new component that is able to create different chart type templates (components of type ChartTypeTemplate)

methods.name: setFirstDiagram
desc: Notes: this is preliminary, we need an API that supports more than one diagram. The method name setDiagram exists in the css.chart API, so there is would be no way to chose either this or the other method from Basic (it would chose one or the other by random).
